findings.title: Missing check for the amount
findings.description: There is no check for the `_amount` which a user needs to claim and `_pathFundAmount` which a user will get after sending ETH to the contract.

findings.title: Missing method to transfer accumulated fee
findings.description: While the user stakes the token, the contract is deducting a percentage of the amount for the fee. The fee gets accumulated but there is no way to claim/transfer the accumulated fees to the owner/recipient.

findings.title: Missing method to transfer ETH
findings.description: While transferring the _pathFundAmount to the user in return of ETH received, there should be a method to transfer/claim the ETH via another.

findings.title: Use of block.timestamp
findings.description: The value of block.timestamp can be manipulated by the miner and conditions with strict equality are difficult to achieve.

findings.title: Missing method and variable for staking fee
findings.description: The stake fee (9%) is hardcoded and there is no way to update the stake fee in the future.

findings.title: Length calculation within the loop
findings.description: Avoid calculating `_stakeHolders.length` within a loop and instead store it in a local variable before using it in the for loop.

findings.title: Unnecessary use of Openzeppelin SafeMath
findings.description: Solidity version 0.8 was released with SafeMath checks inbuilt, we can avoid using an explicit safe math library.

findings.title: Unnecessary use of bool checks in require method
findings.description: For a mapping that is returning a bool value, the equality check is not necessary.

findings.title: Unnecessary initialization of finePercentage
findings.description: The variable `_finePercentage` is used once in the `if` block of `unStakeCoins()` method and can be removed.

findings.title: Naming Conventions
findings.description: The contract does not follow a consistent naming convention where private variables have leading '_' and public variables do not.

findings.title: Documentation tag @notice is not valid
findings.description: @notice tag is not valid for non-public state variables, it will cause DocstringParsingError while compiling the code.

findings.title: Unnecessary use of “if” and “else” block
findings.description: In `isValidSigner` method of “Verify.sol” contract there is a use of “IF” and “ELSE” blocks which is unnecessary for single line code
